creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
text: This small bamboo brush holder is deeply carved depicting a crab nestling into a group of lotus pods. The technique used here is called hsien-ti shen-k'e or sunken ground deep carving, a technique developed by Ch'ing artisans in the early part of the Ch'ien-lung reign (1736-1795). The relatively naturalistic carving is derived from small format painting and the eyes of the crab are inlaid with hardstone.
title: Brush Pot
